org.jcvi.jillion.internal.trace.chromat.scf.header.pos

Interface PositionStrategy

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BytePositionStrategy, ShortPositionStrategy

    public interface PositionStrategy
    PositionStrategy hides the implementation details of how the SCF file stores position information.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getMaxAllowedValue()
      The maximum value a position is allowed to be for this PositionStrategy implementation.
      short getPosition(DataInputStream in)
      Get the next position from the SCF data.
      byte getSampleSize()
      The number of bytes required for each encoded position.
      void setPosition(short position, ByteBuffer buffer)
      encode the given position into the given ByteBuffer.

    • Method Detail

      • getPosition

        short getPosition(DataInputStream in)
           throws IOException
        Get the next position from the SCF data.
        Parameters:
        in - DataInputStream of the SCF data.
        Returns:
        a short which is the next position.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there are any problems fetching the next position.

      • setPosition

        void setPosition(short position,
                 ByteBuffer buffer)
        encode the given position into the given ByteBuffer.
        Parameters:
        position - the position to encode.
        buffer - the ByteBuffer to write the encoded position.

      • getMaxAllowedValue

        int getMaxAllowedValue()
        The maximum value a position is allowed to be for this PositionStrategy implementation.
        Returns:
        the max possible value a position can be.

      • getSampleSize

        byte getSampleSize()
        The number of bytes required for each encoded position.
        Returns:
        a very small number, probably 1 or 2.
